abstract.p: Executive changes are announced at Universal McCann in New York, Mediasmith, DDB Latin America and GCI Group (S)

block.p: Executives at four agencies are changing posts.

Roberta Garfinkle, one of the best-known media directors specializing in print, is leaving her position as senior vice president for strategic print services at Universal McCann in New York, part of the McCann-Erickson World Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies.
Executives at four agencies are changing posts.

Roberta Garfinkle, one of the best-known media directors specializing in print, is leaving her position as senior vice president for strategic print services at Universal McCann in New York, part of the McCann-Erickson World Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies.

''I've decided I want to retire while I'm young enough and healthy enough to enjoy it,'' Ms. Garfinkle said. Susan Irwin, a spokeswoman for McCann, said that Ms. Garfinkle would serve as a part-time consultant to the agency, adding that a number of Ms. Garfinkle's duties would be assumed by Elizabeth Eisenberg, assistant director for print services, who is being promoted to associate director.

Michael D. Drexler was named to head a new New York office of Mediasmith, a media services agency specializing in interactive media, as executive vice president. Mediasmith is based in San Francisco. Mr. Drexler, 61, recently left his post as executive vice president and worldwide media director at FCB Worldwide in New York, part of True North Communications.

Eduardo Fernandez Ribeiro, president at Slogan DDB in Montevideo, Uruguay, which is 40 percent owned by the DDB Worldwide unit of the Omnicom Group, was named president at DDB Latin America, succeeding Darryl Lindberg, who left.

Mr. Fernandez, 43, will oversee the Latin American region as well as a new Miami office for DDB and a new Latin American management team. Tita Navia, 39, executive vice president at the DDB office in Cali, Colombia, was named to the new post of director for Latin American multinational accounts. Doris Walczyk, 35, director for business development at DDB Latin America, will relocate to Miami from New York. And Steve Burton, 48, chief financial officer for DDB Asia and Latin America, was named chief operating officer for DDB Latin America, a new post in New York.

And at the GCI Group, part of the Grey Global Group, Tom Reno was named executive vice president and managing director at the New York office, succeeding Aaron Kwittken, who left to become vice president for strategy and communications at incuVest in New York. Mr. Reno, 38, had been a managing director at Makovsky & Company in New York.
